body_html:
@lissyx Maybe the control inputs slow down the model. Actually, only for those nodes within a while loop (e.g. nodes in dynamic_rnn), it is necessary to add control inputs when quantizing them.

Personally, I add it iff the node name contain "/rnn/while/". This is a simple method but work for my model 😥, I think you can try it too. And I expect someone prove a more precise way to identify nodes in while loop 😄 .
body_text:
@lissyx Maybe the control inputs slow down the model. Actually, only for those nodes within a while loop (e.g. nodes in dynamic_rnn), it is necessary to add control inputs when quantizing them.
Personally, I add it iff the node name contain "/rnn/while/". This is a simple method but work for my model 😥, I think you can try it too. And I expect someone prove a more precise way to identify nodes in while loop 😄 .
body:
@lissyx Maybe the control inputs slow down the model. Actually, only for those nodes within a while loop (e.g. nodes in dynamic_rnn), it is necessary to add control inputs when quantizing them.

Personally, I add it iff the node name contain "/rnn/while/". This is a simple method but work for my model 😥, I think you can try it too. And I expect someone prove a more precise way to identify nodes in while loop 😄 .
